title: How to Deactivate user-feedback in "deeplabcut.extract_outlier_frames(config_path, videos)"
body:
Hi everyone, Thanks for this community and amazing tool ! :) Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using. Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x. Please complete the following information about your system: OS: [Ubuntu 20.04] DeepLabCut Version: [e.g. 2.2] (2.1.10) Anaconda env used: **Describe the problem** I just wanted to ask how to deactivate the user-feedback in the function "deeplabcut.extract_outlier_frames(config_path, videos)". I just want the program to extract outlier frames without asking for my consent for each of my 68 videos. Please place code inside this: deeplabcut.extract_outlier_frames(config_path, videos) [Method jump found 663 putative outlier frames. Do you want to proceed with extracting 2 of those? If this list is very large, perhaps consider changing the parameters (start, stop, p_bound, comparisonbodyparts) or use a different method. yes/noyes Frames from video 210122_f84_2021.03.23_000_locomotionTriggerSIAndMotor60sec_001-002_raw_behavior already extracted (more will be added)! Loading video... Duration of video [s]: 150.0 , recorded @ 80.0 fps! Overall # of frames: 12000 with (cropped) frame dimensions: Kmeans-quantization based extracting of frames from 0.0 seconds to 150.0 seconds. Extracting and downsampling... 663 frames from the video. 663it [00:14, 45.72it/s] Kmeans clustering ... (this might take a while) Let's select frames indices: [5051, 7408] New video was added to the project! Use the function 'extract_frames' to select frames for labeling. The outlier frames are extracted. They are stored in the subdirectory labeled-data\210122_f84_2021.03.23_000_locomotionTriggerSIAndMotor60sec_001-002_raw_behavior. Once you extracted frames for all videos, use 'refine_labels' to manually correct the labels. Method jump found 187 putative outlier frames. Do you want to proceed with extracting 2 of those? If this list is very large, perhaps consider changing the parameters (start, stop, p_bound, comparisonbodyparts) or use a different method. yes/noyes ![user feedback](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70333713/117261741-cb846400-ae50-11eb-97c4-304952131583.png) ![user feedback](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70333713/117261805-db03ad00-ae50-11eb-968e-b150defe88c6.png) ]

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to '...' 2. Click on '....' 3. Scroll down to '....' 4. See error **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here.
